result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:15 AM Defendant Benjamin J. Zigler in court in person and in custody with attorney Walter H Isaacson in person.  Gerald Anthony Urbik appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. Defense withdraws motion for bail modification. Matter to be set per scheduling order.

Activity: Preliminary hearing and Arraignment
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

8:41 AM Defendant Benjamin J. Zigler in court in custody by video at the Rock County Jail with attorney Walter H Isaacson by video. Gerald Anthony Urbik appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant's attorney, reading waived. Defendant's attorney pleads not guilty. Parties argue motion to modify bond. Court denies motion to modify bond. Matter continued to date already scheduled with Judge Hanson on June 23, 2022 at 10:15AM.
